primary_diagnosis.description: Major depressive disorder, recurrent, severe, without psychotic features
primary_diagnosis.justification: The patient reports 7 out of 9 symptoms of a Major Depressive Episode (MDE), including *severe sadness*, *anhedonia*, and passive *thoughts of death*. This episode has lasted 3 months, meeting duration criteria. History confirms a previous episode 2 years ago, warranting the recurrent specifier (F33.x). Severity is designated as 'severe' due to the high symptom burden (7/9) and the documented functional impairment/lack of adequate response to the current dose of *Fluoxetine*.
dsm_criteria_met: A1: Depressed mood most of the day, nearly every day (Severe sadness)
A2: Markedly diminished interest or pleasure (Anhedonia)
A4: Fatigue or loss of energy
A5: Feelings of worthlessness or excessive inappropriate guilt
A7: Diminished ability to think or concentrate
A9: Recurrent thoughts of death (Suicidal ideation present, without plan/intent)

ruled_out.reason: History confirms a previous depressive episode 2 years ago, establishing recurrence.
Patient reports no history of *mania* or *hypomania*.
Symptoms are overwhelmingly indicative of a depressive episode; insufficient data to meet independent criteria for GAD as a secondary diagnosis.

protective_factors: Explicit denial of active intent or plan to act (Category 4/5 excluded)
Identifies family as a significant deterrent to self-harm ('I couldn't do that to them')
risk_factors: Presence of severe vegetative symptoms of *depression* (early morning awakening, *anorexia*, *weight loss*)
Expressed feelings of *worthlessness* and extreme *guilt* ('I'm a failure', 'letting everyone down')
Non-specific active ideation regarding family being 'better off' without them
Functional impairment (missing three days of work)
Lack of efficacy of current *Sertraline* 50mg dose
clinical_actions: Continue monitoring for increased risk and ideation specificity
